sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都有"希望"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: desire, wish, hope, expect, want, long
means: desire ： 语气较正式庄重，着重渴望的力量与热切，常含有强烈的意图和目的。
wish ： 语气较弱，多指难于实现或不可能实现的愿望。
hope ： 指对愿望实现有一定信心的希望。
expect ： 通常指有很大程度的把握，但仍含有预料之意，或预计某事或某行动的发生。
want ： 一般指所想要的东西是切望得到的东西，能弥补实际需要。
long ： 语气强，指极殷切地盼望着，这种盼望侧重于很难或不可能得到的东西。有时也指一般愿望，但含一定感情色彩。

sentence.Network_en: "I wish I had a little brother," said Daphne wistfully.
sentence.Network_cn: “我希望有个小弟弟。”达夫妮伤感地说。

sentence.Network_en: They have no wish for any change in the status quo.
I just wanted to wish you a merry Christmas.
sentence.Network_cn: 我只想祝福你圣诞快乐。

jx.jx_en_mean: (proverb)if you could achieve your aims simply by wishing for them, life would be very easy

jx.jx_en_mean: feel or express a desire for someone's well-being

jx.jx_cn_mean: (谚)愿望是思想之父；希望什么就相信什么

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English wȳscan, of Germanic origin; related to German wünschen, also to ween and wont

entry.def: A wish is a desire or strong feeling that you want to have something or do something.

example.ex: She was sincere and genuine in her wish to make amends for the past...
example.tran: 她真诚地希望弥补从前的过失。

example.ex: Clearly she had no wish for conversation...

entry.def: If you wish to do something or to have it done for you, you want to do it or have it done.

example.ex: If you wish to go away for the weekend, our office will be delighted to make hotel reservations...
example.tran: 如果您想外出度周末，我们办事处将很乐意为您预订旅馆。

example.ex: We can dress as we wish now...
example.tran: 我们现在着装可以随心所欲。

entry.tran: (用于要说的话可能使人不快或担心等时)不想，无意
entry.def: Wish is used in expressions such as I don't wish to be rude or without wishing to be rude as a way of apologizing or warning someone when you are going to say something which might upset, annoy, or worry them.

example.ex: I don't wish to sound callous, but I am glad I wasn't here...
example.tran: 我不想让自己的话听上去麻木不仁，但我真的很庆幸我当时没在这儿。

example.ex: Without wishing to be unkind, she's not the most interesting company.
example.tran: 我不想那么刻薄，不过她并不是非常有情趣的伴侣。

entry.tran: 希望(不可能或可能性很小的事发生)
entry.def: If you wish something were true, you would like it to be true, even though you know that it is impossible or unlikely.

example.ex: I wish I could do that...

entry.def: If you wish for something, you express the desire for that thing silently to yourself. In fairy stories, when a person wishes for something, the thing they wish for often happens by magic.

example.ex: We have all wished for men who are more considerate...
example.tran: 我们都曾祈求能找到更加体贴的男人。

example.ex: A philosopher once said, 'Be careful what you wish for; you might get it.'
example.tran: 一位哲学家曾说过：“别轻易许愿——你可能会如愿以偿。”

entry.tran: 这是再好不过的;没有比这更好的了
entry.def: Wish is used in sentences such as I could not wish for anything better to indicate that you are very pleased with what you have and could not imagine anything better.

example.ex: I really could not have wished for a better teacher...
example.tran: 这个老师对我来说是再好不过的了。

example.ex: Who could wish for a better opportunity?
example.tran: 谁还会企求能得到比这更好的机会呢？

entry.def: If you say that you would not wish a particular thing on someone, you mean that the thing is so unpleasant that you would not want them to be forced to experience it.

example.ex: It's a horrid experience and I wouldn't wish it on my worst enemy.
example.tran: 这种经历太痛苦了，我甚至都不希望它发生在死对头身上。

entry.def: If you wish someone something such as luck or happiness, you express the hope that they will be lucky or happy.

example.ex: I wish you both a very good journey...
example.tran: 我祝愿你们两人旅途愉快。

example.ex: Goodbye, Hanu. I wish you well.
example.tran: 再见，哈努，祝你顺心如意。

entry.def: If you express your good wishes towards someone, you are politely expressing your friendly feelings towards them and your hope that they will be successful or happy.

example.ex: I found George's story very sad. Please give him my best wishes...
example.tran: 我觉得乔治的经历很悲惨，请向他转达我最诚挚的祝福。

example.ex: Western leaders sent good wishes to the new American president.
example.tran: 西方领导人向新任美国总统致以良好的祝愿。

sentences.sentence: "he was above all wishing and desire"

means.word_mean: 2. an expression of some desire or inclination;

sentences.sentence: "I could tell that it was his wish that the guests leave"
"his crying was an indirect request for attention"

means.word_mean: 3. (usually plural) a polite expression of desire for someone's welfare;
4. the particular preference that you have;

sentences.sentence: "they should respect the wishes of the people"
"I wish I could go home now"

means.word_mean: 2. prefer or wish to do something;

sentences.sentence: "Do you care to try this dish?"
"Would you like to come along to the movies?"

means.word_mean: 5. feel or express a desire or hope concerning the future or fortune of
6. order politely; express a wish for

Sentence.sentence: We wish you success in your new business.
After her unhappy marriage to a man who was trying to control her without considering her wishes and feelings ,she says, " it's very important to me to carry my own weight
I wish Jane would call when she know she'll be late.
It's possible to admire Oprah Winfrey and still wish Harvard hadn't awarded her an honorary doctor of law degree and the commencement(毕业典礼)speaker spot at yesterday's graduation.
Few of us wish to turn the clock back, but perhaps we need to remind ourselves how useful the right obstacles can be.
According to the college, the plan is designed for high-ability, highly motivated student who wish to save money or to move along more rapidly toward advanced degrees.

sentences.en: We can get to work now if you wish.
sentences.cn: 要是你愿意, 我们可以马上干起来。

sentences.en: Do you wish wine with your meal, sir?
sentences.cn: 先生, 你希望吃饭时喝点酒吗?

sentences.en: They informed him that they wished reconciliation.
sentences.cn: 他们告诉他, 他们愿意和解。

sentences.en: How I wish I was there with you.
sentences.cn: 我要是也在那儿和你们在一起就好了。

sentences.en: I wish that I had never met him.
His colleagues wished him happiness on his retirement.
sentences.cn: 他退休时同事们祝他幸福。

means.word_mean: 渴望, 希望, 盼望, 愿望

sentences.en: Our wish for better times has come true.
sentences.cn: 我们要过好日子的愿望已实现。

means.word_mean: 希望的事, 想要的东西

sentences.en: She wanted a new bike for Christmas and she got her wish.
sentences.cn: 她想在圣诞节得到一辆新的脚踏车, 结果如愿以偿了。

means.word_mean: 许愿, 祈祷, 祈求

sentences.en: He closed his eyes and made a wish.
I have no wish for a well-paid position.
sentences.cn: 我不祈求待遇优厚的职位。

jushi.english: I don't think I ought to, but I will if you wish.
jushi.chinese: 我觉得我不该这样,但如果你希望我就照办。

jushi.english: Do you wish when you see a shooting star?
jushi.chinese: 当你看见流星时你许愿吗?
